intro: Chrysosplenium geoides, commonly known as the mountain spleenwort, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the family Saxifragaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and features small, kidney-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of delicate, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
